instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-3476: What is 820-3476? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not powering on.
threads.message: Hi There. I have MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 model,<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A  its not powering on and when I connect charger its <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR> getting hot .and voltage 14.5 V, Please help . Thanks.

threads.title: MacBook <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2014 <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3476</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-A Not powering on.
threads.message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

"voltage 14.5 V"
At <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?

Post diode mode to ground at L7130.
